intro: Licania axilliflora, commonly known as the axillary-flowered licania, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Licania axilliflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
